qas.question: Symptoms ranging from diarrhea to eye lesions are from what?
What is a symptom of both zinc deficiency and excess?
What is required for animals with zinc deficiency to gain the same weight as animals with sufficient zinc?
What prevents symptoms ranging from diarrhea to eye lesions?
What is not required for animals with zinc deficiency to gain the same weight as animals with sufficient zinc?
What is no longer a symptom of both zinc deficiency and excess?
Why do animals not consume zinc in their diet?

context: Symptoms of <a0_0><b3_0>mild zinc deficiency<b3_0/><a0_0/> are diverse. Clinical outcomes include <b6_0>depressed growth<b6_0/>, diarrhea, impotence and delayed sexual maturation, alopecia, eye and skin lesions, impaired appetite, altered cognition, impaired host defense properties, defects in carbohydrate utilization, and reproductive teratogenesis. Mild zinc deficiency <a1_0><b5_0>depresses immunity<b5_0/><a1_0/>, although excessive zinc does also. Animals with a diet deficient in zinc require <a2_0><b4_0>twice as much food<b4_0/><a2_0/> in order to attain the same weight gain as animals given sufficient zinc.
